tasks.task: Farming operations involving pea and mustard cultivation with integrated crop management.
subtasks: Planting pea and mustard seeds with appropriate seeding rates.
Implementing Clearfield technology for herbicide tolerance.
Applying grass herbicide for weed control without using Raptor or Beyond.
Managing hail damage through timely desiccation and harvest.
Utilizing stripper headers and draper headers for efficient harvest of mixed crops.
Adjusting seed rates based on crop performance and residue management.
Evaluating disease resistance (e.g., root rot) in rotated and non-rotated crops.
Considering fertilizer and chemical costs in variable-rate management.
Assessing net income from intercropping versus monoculture.
Monitoring pest management (e.g., flea beetle) in integrated crop systems.
Evaluating the effectiveness of complementary crops (e.g., mustard) in disease control.

tasks.task: Harvest and post-harvest management of intercropped fields.
subtasks: Disposing of desiccated crops with combined pea and mustard yields.
Evaluating shatter resistance of chickpeas and flax in mixed crops.
Handling residue left after harvest for erosion control and wildlife habitat.
Applying pre-plant herbicides for broadleaf weed control.
Monitoring and adjusting seed rates for weed suppression and crop competition.
Rotating crops to minimize pathogens (e.g., root rot) and pests.
Using brassica crops (e.g., mustard) for anti-fungal properties.
Leaving residue for soil health and erosion control.
Implementing clean grain trains for post-harvest grain handling.
